key_points: President Joe Biden issued an executive order to speed up stimulus check payments for 8 million Americans who missed earlier rounds.
The order directs the Treasury Department to re-evaluate its delivery methods for stimulus checks.
An estimated 8 million eligible Americans did not receive the first $1,200 stimulus checks from the CARES Act.
The Treasury Department is tasked with creating online tools and outreach efforts to help eligible individuals claim their missed payments.
Efforts to address the issue of missed payments include the IRS launching an online non-filer tool and a media campaign.
IRS Commissioner Chuck Rettig reported that 8 million eligible people had not used the non-filer portal as of last fall.
Samantha Jacoby, senior tax legal analyst at the Center on Budget and Policy Priorities, praised the administration's focus on assisting low-income individuals who missed payments.
The executive order is part of Biden's broader efforts to provide financial relief during the COVID-19 pandemic.
The number of Americans who missed out on stimulus checks could be even higher than 8 million.
The Biden administration aims to ensure all entitled Americans receive their stimulus checks.
spokespersons: Samantha Jacoby (Senior Tax Legal Analyst, Center on Budget and Policy Priorities)
